detaileddescription.para: Binary/C variable
File in filesystem
Symbol (lv_symbol_def.h)
Source of image.
Contains the file as it is. Needs custom decoder function
Contains the file as it is. The image has alpha. Needs custom decoder function
Contains the file as it is. The image is chroma keyed. Needs custom decoder function
Color format and depth should match with LV_COLOR settings
Same as LV_IMG_CF_TRUE_COLOR but every pixel has an alpha byte
Same as LV_IMG_CF_TRUE_COLOR but LV_COLOR_TRANSP pixels will be transparent
Can have 2 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have 4 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have 16 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have 256 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have one color and it can be drawn or not
Can have one color but 4 different alpha value
Can have one color but 16 different alpha value
Can have one color but 256 different alpha value

memberdef.definition: typedef lv_res_t(* lv_img_decoder_info_f_t) (struct _lv_img_decoder *decoder, const void *src, lv_img_header_t *header)
memberdef.name: lv_img_decoder_info_f_t

detaileddescription.para:
Get info from an image and store in the header
src
the image source. Can be a pointer to a C array or a file name (Use lv_img_src_get_type to determine the type)
header
store the info here
LV_RES_OK: info written correctly; LV_RES_INV: failed

Open an image for decoding. Prepare it as it is required to read it later
decoder
pointer to the decoder the function associated with
dsc
pointer to decoder descriptor. src, style are already initialized in it.

memberdef.definition: typedef lv_res_t(* lv_img_decoder_read_line_f_t) (struct _lv_img_decoder *decoder, struct _lv_img_decoder_dsc *dsc, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_coord_t len, uint8_t *buf)
memberdef.argsstring: )(struct _lv_img_decoder *decoder, struct _lv_img_decoder_dsc *dsc, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_coord_t len, uint8_t *buf)
memberdef.name: lv_img_decoder_read_line_f_t

detaileddescription.para:
Decode len pixels starting from the given x, y coordinates and store them in buf. Required only if the "open" function can't return with the whole decoded pixel array.
decoder
pointer to the decoder the function associated with
dsc
pointer to decoder descriptor
x
start x coordinate
y
start y coordinate
len
number of pixels to decode
buf
a buffer to store the decoded pixels
LV_RES_OK: ok; LV_RES_INV: failed

Close the pending decoding. Free resources etc.
decoder
pointer to the decoder the function associated with
dsc
pointer to decoder descriptor
Describe an image decoding session. Stores data about the decoding
Initialize the image decoder module

Get information about an image. Try the created image decoder one by one. Once one is able to get info that info will be used.
src
the image source. Can be 1) File name: E.g. "S:folder/img1.png" (The drivers needs to registered via lv_fs_add_drv()) 2) Variable: Pointer to an lv_img_dsc_t variable 3) Symbol: E.g. LV_SYMBOL_OK
header
the image info will be stored here
LV_RES_OK: success; LV_RES_INV: wasn't able to get info about the image

Open an image. Try the created image decoder one by one. Once one is able to open the image that decoder is save in dsc
dsc
describe a decoding session. Simply a pointer to an lv_img_decoder_dsc_t variable.
src
the image source. Can be 1) File name: E.g. "S:folder/img1.png" (The drivers needs to registered via lv_fs_add_drv()) 2) Variable: Pointer to an lv_img_dsc_t variable 3) Symbol: E.g. LV_SYMBOL_OK
style
the style of the image
LV_RES_OK: opened the image. dsc->img_data and dsc->header are set. LV_RES_INV: none of the registered image decoders were able to open the image.

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_img_decoder_dsc_t *dsc, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_coord_t len, uint8_t *buf)
memberdef.name: lv_img_decoder_read_line

detaileddescription.para:
Read a line from an opened image
dsc
pointer to lv_img_decoder_dsc_t used in lv_img_decoder_open
x
start X coordinate (from left)
y
start Y coordinate (from top)
len
number of pixels to read
buf
store the data here
LV_RES_OK: success; LV_RES_INV: an error occurred

Close a decoding session
dsc
pointer to lv_img_decoder_dsc_t used in lv_img_decoder_open

Create a new image decoder
pointer to the new image decoder

Delete an image decoder
decoder
pointer to an image decoder

Set a callback to get information about the image
decoder
pointer to an image decoder
info_cb
a function to collect info about an image (fill an lv_img_header_t struct)

Set a callback to open an image
decoder
pointer to an image decoder
open_cb
a function to open an image

Set a callback to a decoded line of an image
decoder
pointer to an image decoder
read_line_cb
a function to read a line of an image

Set a callback to close a decoding session. E.g. close files and free other resources.
decoder
pointer to an image decoder
close_cb
a function to close a decoding session
